unnormalised: The Govt. is thinking of simplifying GST even more! Apparently, they're looking at merging some tax slabs.
normalised: The Government is thinking of simplifying G-S-T even more! Apparently, they are looking at merging some tax slabs.

unnormalised: Right now, we have 5%, 12%, 18%, and 28%. There’s also 0% for essentials, of course. Some experts are saying they might consolidate into just 2 or 3 main rates. This would make it easier for businesses, especially SMEs, to file their returns. Less confusion, less paperwork, right?
normalised: Right now, we have five percent, twelve percent, eighteen percent, and twenty eight percent. There is also zero percent for essentials, of course. Some experts are saying they might consolidate into just two or three main rates. This would make it easier for businesses, especially S-M-Es, to file their returns. Less confusion, less paperwork, right?

unnormalised: The FM (Finance Minister) hinted at this in a recent speech. She said that the current system is “too complex” and needs streamlining. No kidding! Imagine trying to figure out which slab applies to your particular widget. It's a headache!
normalised: The F-M (Finance Minister) hinted at this in a recent speech. She said that the current system is “too complex” and needs streamlining. No kidding! Imagine trying to figure out which slab applies to your particular widget. It is a headache!

unnormalised: One suggestion is to have a lower rate (maybe around 8%) for essential goods and services and a standard rate (perhaps 15%) for everything else. There could also be a higher rate for luxury items, maybe 25%, but nothing is confirmed yet.
normalised: One suggestion is to have a lower rate (maybe around eight percent) for essential goods and services and a standard rate (perhaps fifteen percent) for everything else. There could also be a higher rate for luxury items, maybe twenty five percent, but nothing is confirmed yet.

unnormalised: The GST Council is meeting next month, on 15/07/2024, and this could be a big topic of discussion. A final decision is expected by the end of the year, hopefully.
normalised: The G-S-T Council is meeting next month, on fifteenth july two thousand and twenty four, and this could be a big topic of discussion. A final decision is expected by the end of the year, hopefully.

unnormalised: This is potentially huge for everyone, from big companies like Tata to your local kirana store. Less ambiguity means more compliance and a potentially bigger tax base. Plus, it could lead to lower prices for consumers, which is always a good thing!
normalised: This is potentially huge for everyone, from big companies like Tata to your local kirana store. Less ambiguity means more compliance and a potentially bigger tax base. Plus, it could lead to lower prices for consumers, which is always a good thing!

unnormalised: Advocate Sharma, a tax expert, told NDTV that "this simplification is long overdue". She believes it will reduce litigation and make the tax system more efficient. Let’s hope they actually manage to pull it off this time!
normalised: Advocate Sharma, a tax expert, told N-D-T-V that "this simplification is long overdue". She believes it will reduce litigation and make the tax system more efficient. Let us hope they actually manage to pull it off this time!

unnormalised: And if the GST is simplified, the Govt. might then think of reforming income tax too, says some sources inside the Ministry of Finance!
normalised: And if the G-S-T is simplified, the Government might then think of reforming income tax too, says some sources inside the Ministry of Finance!
